channel.title: News on AI-Lab
channel.description: Recent content in News on AI-Lab

item.title: Dr Lan's Team Unveils 3 Cutting-Edge Research at AMAM Conference
item.description: In a collaborative effort, Dr Lan and his team made significant contributions to the 11th International Symposium on Adaptive Motion of Animals and Machines (AMAM) in Kobe, Japan. Their groundbreaking research delved into the realms of aerodynamics and odour tracking, providing valuable insights at the intersection of animal locomotion and technology.

item.title: Dr Lan to Give Keynote Speech at National Defense University
item.description: Dr Lan delivers an inspiring speech on the application of odour sensing at National Defense University.

item.title: Six Talented Individuals Join The Lab
item.description: A master student, four bachelor students and an exchange student joined the lab, welcome on board.

item.title: Dr Lan Invited to Give Talk at CSME Conference
item.description: Dr Lan gives a speech entitled ‘Machine Learning in Flapping Flight Transient Acceleration Modelling’ at CSME 2022.

item.title: Three Talented Individuals Join The Lab
item.description: Three master students joined the lab, welcome on board.

item.title: New Journal Paper on Drones
item.description: Great news! The paper titled ‘A Neural Network Approach to Estimate Transient Aerodynamic Properties of a Flapping Wing System’ by Lan et al. has been published in the journal Drones. Congratulations! For more information please refer to https://doi.org/10.3390/drones6080210.

item.title: Research Reported by AIP
item.description: The research conducted in the paper ‘Optimal thrust efficiency for a tandem wing in forward flight using varied hindwing kinematics of a damselfly’ was reported by AIP Scilight, congratulations. For more information please refer to https://aip.scitation.org/doi/full/10.1063/10.0012500.

item.title: Paper Accepted by Physics of Fluids
item.description: The paper ‘Optimal thrust efficiency for a tandem wing in forward flight using varied hindwing kinematics of a damselfly’ was accepted by the journal Physics of Fluids, congratulations. For more information please refer to https://doi.org/10.1063/5.0093208.

item.title: Lab Website Launched
item.description: The ‘Advanced Integration Laboratory (AI-Lab)’ will be establish on 01 August 2022. To make more people understand our works, we launched this site for showing our research projects and results.
